unnormalised: Hey folks, ever wonder what happens to all that leftover biryani and Diwali mithai containers? Waste management in India is getting a much-needed boost!
normalised: Hey folks, ever wonder what happens to all that leftover biryani and Diwali mithai containers? Waste management in India is getting a much-needed boost!

unnormalised: The IIT-Delhi just announced a new initiative to develop biodegradable plastics from agricultural waste. Imagine, banana peels turning into shopping bags! That's some serious "Swades" level innovation right there, reminding us of SRK's character bringing technology back to his roots.
normalised: The I I T-Delhi just announced a new initiative to develop biodegradable plastics from agricultural waste. Imagine, banana peels turning into shopping bags! That's some serious "Swades" level innovation right there, reminding us of S R K's character bringing technology back to his roots.

unnormalised: Speaking of roots, the Mumbai Municipal Corporation is piloting a new program in Andheri West – door-to-door segregation of wet and dry waste. They're hoping to reduce the amount of garbage ending up in the Deonar dumping ground by a whopping 30% in the next year.
normalised: Speaking of roots, the Mumbai Municipal Corporation is piloting a new program in Andheri West – door-to-door segregation of wet and dry waste. They're hoping to reduce the amount of garbage ending up in the Deonar dumping ground by a whopping thirty percent in the next year.

unnormalised: Apparently, Rs. 500 crores have been allocated for improving waste processing facilities across the state of Maharashtra alone. But, let's be honest, fancy technology is only half the battle. Real change requires all of us to be a little more mindful about our waste – sort it, compost it, and recycle! Every little bit helps keep our beloved Bharat clean. Let's all do our bit!
normalised: Apparently, rupee five hundred crores have been allocated for improving waste processing facilities across the state of Maharashtra alone. But, let's be honest, fancy technology is only half the battle. Real change requires all of us to be a little more mindful about our waste – sort it, compost it, and recycle! Every little bit helps keep our beloved Bharat clean. Let's all do our bit!
